website_summaries.verdict: Those seeking a handy water-resistant pack with various features and compartments should check out this popular option.
pros: Waterproof roll-top to protect laptop and other valuables
Multiple carabiner straps on front of pack
Offers custom-fit straps for supreme comfort
cons: Quality of seams and fabric could be better

customer_reviews.title: versatile pack
customer_reviews.text: Been using this as my primary backpack for three years now. Lots of compliments! Pretty good pack, just wish it was built better. Pros: chest strap very versatile pack - roll-top is SUPER handy to have, Front velcro holds my bike lock in place water bottle pocket (never owning a pack without one) Solid comfort level Con: Not the greatest materials (Made in China) - a couple seams are ripping, water bottle meshing ripped early on, on one side the waterproof backing is crumbling off. (personal con: The outer velcro attracts everything, endless fuzzes caught in there, and has ruined multiple sweaters/scarves)
customer_reviews.author: Suzi

customer_reviews.title: Works well... I mean it's a Timbuk2 backpack.
customer_reviews.text: The backpack works as expected. It's not too heavy, but it is heavier than your typical Jansport basic backpack. It also seems fairly secure and there's an unzippable area in the back so you can easily access your laptop or either items without having to undo the front flap. The loops are cool looking, and help in giving a place to put carabiners and locks. I wish it had one more beverage pocket on the other side and for whatever reason it oftentimes feels too small on the inside even though I know it can hold more items (i.e., there's not that much stretch or give when cramming stuff).
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: A backpack so nice she got it twice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement backpack for someone who had owned one before. It had gotten tossed due to getting something nasty spilled inside, and she liked it enough to request another. I contemplated a Herschel or a Fjallraven backpack until she (not so subtly) sent me a link with the backpack she wanted, on some sort of Black Friday sale. Done! Some of the reasons she loves it: the all black color; the straps; enormous amount of space inside; and the size is ideal (smaller backpacks can make someone who isn’t petite look like a giant, and one that’s too big would be too heavy).
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: Awesome backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research to replace my everyday bag; I wanted something that could fit all my stuff at once for my city commutes: gym clothes, lunch, coffee mug, a book and my books for my French class. This bag does the trick and is good looking, seems well-made, and isn’t too heavy. I like the hidden zip pocket, quick laptop access for travel, and water resistance. It turns out my brother has had this bag for 7 years and swears by it, so I hope mine holds up as well as his. My husband bought one too!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B

customer_reviews.title: Love love love love love this bag.
customer_reviews.text: I am super picky when it comes to backpacks. When I find one that I love, I keep it forever. I was carrying a bag from another company but they stopped making it. I needed a new bag and after testing a few out, I found this one. It’s PERFECT. The space inside is insane, the materials are VERY sturdy and feel like quality, and the bag looks pretty dope to boot. It’s a great compromise between a functional travel bag, a ruck sack and a bag that I can stylishly carry to the office. Well done Timbuk2
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bag for travelling light.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this bag. I primarily bought this for my travel to Japan. My company told me that I should take my work tablet and I realized I didn't have a bag for it. I searched on Amazon for days and I found this bag. It's light weight, easy to use, convenient pockets, padded inner pockets for tablets, water resistant, and also stylish. I just returned from Japan 2 days ago and I'm so glad I bought this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Anchan15

customer_reviews.title: Best Commuter Bag Out There!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag that offers sturdy protection for your devices inside the bag, is water resistant, and pretty much a great commuter bag! It is well built, and nothing feels cheap about it. I’m a teacher and on those rainy days, I don’t want my device or papers getting wet as I walk to class or to my car. It has a lot of storage pockets and areas for organizing your writing utensils and even has, what seem to be, secret compartments (not really, but the zippers allow access into the bag from the outside to make getting your devices quicker.
customer_reviews.author: mofifty4

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy bag, but looks great as well
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this bag after his old Herschel bag bottom fell apart. He specifically looked for a durable bag with a thickened bottom. He has never had a bag with the front strap and is pleasantly surprised how much better that is for weight distribution. Highly recommends for anyone needing a bag that could take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Sven5000

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bag for rainy towns
customer_reviews.text: My son started college in a town known to get lots of rain. He searched online for a waterproof backpack and decided on this one. After a few months of use and a few heavy rains, he's satisfied that his books stay dry and his backpack will protect his bag contents. At first he wasn't sure he'd like the way the top of the bag closed, but he now says it pretty much ensures that the items in the bag don't get wet. The clasp is strong and stands up to repeated daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Tish

customer_reviews.title: Well Built
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built pack, its comfortable to carry for long periods of time with a medium to light load. I would not recommend it for heavy carry, but if you use it for its designed purpose as a light daily carry for your tech you will not be disappointed. I gave this pack a 5 star rating based my use. I carry a laptop , water bottle, light jacket, 2 cameras with minimal accessories and a go pro or 2 . Total weight under 20 pounds .
customer_reviews.author: Matt Mink

customer_reviews.title: A perfect travel backpack
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this backpack for over 4+ years now and this has gone with me to over 10+ countries. This backpack is low profile, rugged, comfortable and just the perfect backpack for practically any light and on the go travel. Even when the backpack is packed, it is still comfortable to use even after all day of carrying it around. The padding on the bag is perfect. I highly recommend this backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Roddy2

customer_reviews.title: Reliable & adaptable.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, pockets are conveniently located. Adequate protection for tablet/laptop. Spacious and adaptable. Roomy enough for laptop, a couple notebook, a textbook, and a jacket. Rear access zipper is excellent, as are the various exterior loops/Velcro. My only complaint is that the strap placement likely intended for a man. Would be great if vertical adjustment range was suited for different torso lengths.
customer_reviews.author: Iztaccíhuatl

customer_reviews.title: Slim, stylish, lots of useless features, and a bad component.
customer_reviews.text: The mollie on the back is loose, and not fully sewn-in. The plastic buckle on the front strap-holder snapped, and I find the straps naturally fall off my broader-than-average shoulders. I want to replace the buckle, but I can't seem to find anything offered by Timbuk2. So the bag is useless unless I tie the straps together across my chest. I can't have this bike falling off every time I ride.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great water resistant laptop backpack
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good, heavy duty backpack and has a nice look. I got it because I wanted a waterproof backpack where I didn't need to worry about my laptop and electronics getting wet if I got caught in the rain. It has a zipper opening to remove the laptop quickly for TSA screening from the top without opening the backpack opening. It has lots of loops and things to hang stuff on, that I don't use much, but maybe I will in the future. It even has a bottle opener on the shoulder strap. I like the color as well. I normally get black or gray, so it is cool to have something a little different.
customer_reviews.author: Sim Harbert

customer_reviews.title: The perfect lightweight commuter bag
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. This is my first timbuk2 and it's perfect... it looks cool, it's waterproof and it keeps it's shape. I carry my laptop, a few books, a small accessory bag, water and a small lunch in it just fine, and the side pocket fits a coffee tumbler or water bottle. Has just enough small pockets and zippers without it getting confusing trying to remember where you put your chapstick or phone!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can put all your dang stuff in this bag
customer_reviews.text: I beat the heck out of this bag through Europe for 2 weeks and it still looks brand spanking new. Great bag for someone who travels light. It fit my 15-inch MacBook pro, the charger, 5 hand selected sikk ass heavy metal shirts, 2 pair of jeans. 5 pair socks and underwear. All my toiletries. Hairbrush to keep my luscious locks in check. A digital recording interface that I didn't use. A microfiber towel. All my papers. A 450 page book about Tiny Tim! My treasured pictures of Tonetta. This bag rules!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof on bottom.
customer_reviews.text: Bike commuter here. Not waterproof. Bottom was very wet after a quick rain storm this morning. Love the look of the pack and how it holds items. Wheel spray was probably what did it. Also, the more you cinch the pack for snugness the more it pinches together at top because the chest strap does not adjust down far enough. I’m using it every day. We will see about durability soon.
customer_reviews.author: PKj

customer_reviews.title: ... I hardly believe it is possible to find smth better for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was lucky to buy it for $50 and I hardly believe it is possible to find smth better for the money. Cloth is not very nice in touch but it is waterproof, durable, functional with lots of sections and access points, so its very good.
customer_reviews.author: Wile E. Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Another Reliable & Stylish Product from Timbuk2
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love my backpack and get many compliments on the bag! The bag is perfect for travel and comfortably fits my laptop, clothing, shoes and my lunch. If you don't care about the color, I'd buy the lowest priced bag. I had a gift card so I was able to to score this bag for $20!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Overall, its a good bag but!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, its a good bag. Padding isn't too great but works for shorter bike rides. Smaller inside pockets get in the way when putting stuff like books or wallets into the bag, mesh pocket has stretched out because of this. Pencil pockets location cause all of them to come out of their pocket when removing stuff from bag. not too much space unless stacking up, will fit very few books. Noticed it had extra stitching on both side as well, not sure if normal. If those arent biggies for you then its a good bag.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: Excellent commuter bag
customer_reviews.text: Roomy, comfortable, secure, fashionable. Good water resistance. Lots of cargo capacity for a lunch or to stash a jacket if it warms up in the afternoon. Extra pocket under the flap is handy. Get some clips or a carabiner if you want to use the cargo straps on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Cothran

customer_reviews.title: Large backpack but not as practical as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: This is a large backpack and fits two laptops, the accessories, and a weekend set of clothing when packed to the top, but I wish it was more elastic as you essentially have a long narrow tube to pack everything into. Makes a little difficult to get items in or out once it is packed.
customer_reviews.author: Santi B.

customer_reviews.title: Useable
customer_reviews.text: Saved my stuff in a rainstorm. There is probably a chance rain could seep through the side. If you have monsoons you might want something 100% waterproof for your stuff. Otherwise this is fantastic . For me I will take my chances with this plus a waterproof sleeve for my MacBook in a downpour.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Well made and great for keeping my laptop dry in the rainy Northwest
customer_reviews.text: Durable, and super waterproof. Needed this in rainy Oregon as I'm often walking between buildings in the rain with my laptop. I also fly a lot and find it is fine for this too. My only gripe is the design makes it a little difficult to find things without unloading first. This may be a result of having such a waterproof design. Certainly it seems very well made and I expect many years of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Bigreader

customer_reviews.title: Ideal Commuter Backpack
customer_reviews.text: After trying several very fashionable looking leather backpacks, I saw a woman at work with one of these and was immediately sold. It can stand heavy downpours and snow. Everything inside stays safe and dry. Easy to get in and out of. I just wish I could figure out how to use the outer bands to carry more stuff without worry. I see how it can carry a bike lock but what else?
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Curtis Gregory

customer_reviews.title: much bigger than it appears!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always been a fan of the TIMBUK2 brand. This is my 3rd bag and this maybe my favorite. This is truly an everyday/commuter bag with super strong velcro straps for your ulock and subtle compartments. Inside the bag has specific places for your laptop and charger while having an inner zipper pocket for loose things. The entire bag opens up like a standard “paper grocery bag”. Super wide and boxy allowing you to fully open your bag up for easy reach for things. Great bag, especially for the price of under $70! No regrets!
customer_reviews.author: Henry J.

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bag for almost a year and have taken this bag on business trips, vacations, and camping adventures. It's been great so far, very roomy, pretty well organized, and easy to clean. I do not use it daily, so I'm not sure how it would stack up durability-wise with more use, but everything seems well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Stan C.

customer_reviews.title: not just big but really big
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pack I could use commuting to/from work that will hold my work product, laptop, lunch and purse. It does that but it isnt easy in/out and it is longer than my torso when packed. I guess it is as designed.. but not a good fit for me
customer_reviews.author: CindyLou Whoiswayover 2

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Backpack for Laptop on a Bicycle + TSA Compliant!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered at least 3 other different backpacks from Amazon. None came close to this in regard to a backpack for a laptop / bicycle / TSA compliant / Water resistant / roomy / Special Laptop & iPad sections, etc.... This Backup was superior to all the others in so many ways! Bonus: NOT made in China!
customer_reviews.author: Desmond Duncker

customer_reviews.title: Good but too narrow
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this bag is average. The quality is amazing. It is for the most part water proof but somehow it does seep in from the back. It is a tall bag but it does not hold much, and what it does hold, tends to get lost in the depths. For comparison, this was replacing the most basic Hershel I had, and I feel like everything fit more comfortably in that bag vice the one being reviewed.
customer_reviews.author: Julio E. Ferreris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is a truly great bag. It feels small, but holds everything I need for bike commuting to work (including my 15 inch laptop, a large water bottle, and an insulated lunch bag). It's great for biking, but my only disappointment is that this bag doesn't come in a bright and/or reflective color. I would have preferred to buy this bag in yellow or orange to boost my safety on the road. As a workaround, I've bought reflective tape to add to the backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: My favorite backpack ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. The Velcro and hook is so nice- I love not having to deal with a zipper. It’s excellent quality. The only thing I wish it had was another water bottle pocket. I highly recommend this pack!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and durability of this backpack. I havent tested it in the rain yet but I am optimistic because the material seems to be high quality and water repellent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend under rain
customer_reviews.text: Love the design, but water will come in and wet the computer under light rain. I'm looking for another backpack which will keep my computer dry after I had really hard time to dry up and rerun my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Cho

customer_reviews.title: Great for the PNW!
customer_reviews.text: I ride the bus to work and sometimes have to wait up to 30 minutes outdoors in the pouring rain. I bought this pack for the waterproofing and it has held up! The pockets are great, material is high quality, and it’s very stylish! I only wish it was slightly smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bag, needs a little more space
customer_reviews.text: Really great backpack, really cool design. The bottle holder on the side is very good and holds everything very secure. The only thing I wish was different was a few more organizational pockets and for the bag to be a bit wider (front to back direction). The organization pockets at the top get in the way of putting stuff in the main compartment. Other than hoping for a bit more space this is a great bag. Highly recommend it. Would give it 4.5 stars if I could, 5 stars would mean it's absolutely perfect and no bag I have found ever is that.
customer_reviews.author: D. Behrman

customer_reviews.title: Fits the 16-inch MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: If anyone was wondering, the Timbuk2 Spire is made for the 15-inch MacBook Pro, but it easily fits the 16-inch MacBook Pro from late 2019. It is a little hard to access the MacBook from the back pocket without inverting the straps, i.e. putting them inside out so they're in the front, not the back. This isn't a big deal at all, and I suspect folks with the 15-inch MBP had to do the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell P.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the old ones.
customer_reviews.text: The original is a great backpack! My new on feels cheaply made all materials are thinner than the original one I got a out 5 years ago. I guess I'll still be using my old one.
customer_reviews.author: L-Dub

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Not been caught in the rain yet but big enough for my laptop. Lunch pale, tablet, over ear headphones, rain jacket and woolly hat. Plus looks good and has a side mesh pocket for my coffee.
customer_reviews.author: SimonSays

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack! sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack! sturdy and durable. I bought this before my trip to Asia. I didn't wanna get one of those sporty travel backpacks and wanted something that suited my style and could use regularly once I returned home. I admit, I could've used More space for my trip but it's been plenty space for my daily use back home. I used to be a Chrome industries guy, but timbuk2 converted me with this one. I highly recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Zara

customer_reviews.title: excellent and spacious all-purpose bag
customer_reviews.text: i was looking for a pack i could use on a city bike excursion, bring a few beers, get groceries on the way home etc- beers remained cold, and i can fit all normal size groceries and then some!! the zippers to get into the bag from the outside are perfectly placed too- easy access to wallet, phone without opening main compartment. the current price is INSANE for what you get!!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan P Hawes

customer_reviews.title: Survived a trip overseas in the heat, then a massive downpour in the cold.
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack. Great features, comfortable, stylish, and it is durable. Took it in the extreme sun/heat for 5 days, then it survived multiple rainstorms, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: John Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Your everyday use bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son. It has become his daily use bag.
customer_reviews.author: tnshluvsjsn

customer_reviews.title: I like this pack overall
customer_reviews.text: I like this pack overall, but it is a little rigidly tight in the chest i.e. the straps are positioned differently than other Timbuk2 packs I own and they cut into my shoulders a bit. Aside from that it is the best daily-use backpack I have ever purchased. Plenty of pockets and access points, nice materials, great looks.
customer_reviews.author: rdk70

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: Awesome backback. Especially if you can get them at a lower price point. But still if not well worth the money. Light weight. Comfortable. Great EDC bag
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband. He started using the bag January 2019. He liked the bag a lot. Unfortunately, after about one month of use the strap broke.
customer_reviews.author: dsanchez

customer_reviews.title: As expected. Quality materials and stitching.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of points of attachment for D-rings, bike lock, lights, reflective attachments. Light rain for 30 minutes and no signs of water penetration. I have been commuting by bike for over 12 years and I am satisfied with this pack. I would purchase again. I do wish there was a waist strap, but I couldn't pass up the value on this pack.
customer_reviews.author: dogg

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I was expecting and has been very useful because of the extra room
customer_reviews.text: Used as my daily carry. Bigger than I was expecting and has been very useful because of the extra room. The way the top fold down works really helps for adjusting the outer size to the amount of stuff I have in it. Excellent quality. Will definitely buy Timbuk2 again.
customer_reviews.author: David Reidy

customer_reviews.title: This Backpack LEAKS, do not buy if you want waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag after researching and trying to buy a good quality waterproof backpack for biking to/from work. If you are buying this bag to commute, DO NOT BUY this bag, it LEAKS. I thought Timbuk2 was high quality but this product failed to deliver on its one objective, being waterproof. This was my first Timbuk2 purchase, never again. My Reebok backpack from Sam's club was more waterproof than this for a fraction of the cost. SAD
customer_reviews.author: Colin Sedushak

customer_reviews.title: Best bag ever
customer_reviews.text: I move around in the city all the time. I have owned this bag for a while now. This backpack goes through a lot. I carry 2 laptops, an ipad, a 1/2 inch folder of paperwork, a 1/2 inch drawing pad, tools, water, a battery brick and 2 portable mouse. It is perfect. Now need to find a messenger bag that can do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kim

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Strong, and Light. Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, lightweight pack can handle my 15 inch laptop and 3 folders easily. The fold down top is a great addition that I initially thought would be a pain, but even with my pens and pencils loaded near the top inside, has never shown an issue. The all black coloring means I can wear it in military uniform and the add on webbing allows me to throw a few extra pieces on there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and Multi-Functional
customer_reviews.text: Overall pretty happy with this purchase 3 months later! There was a small zippered pocket in the main part of the backpack that I didn’t expect - very glad it’s there! The main clasp has an elastic band so it’s always snug. The whole backpack was a tad bulkier than expected. Would probably buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Grelly

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack for the money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bag to become my day to day bag nothing crazy just to work and back. It has exceeded my expectations. There are plenty of different compartments for just about anything. There is even a little compartment in the back for easy access to your laptop. For the price the backpack is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: John Ashworth

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves this backpack. He is a train ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this backpack. He is a train operator and uses this at work and also for his bike commute to and from work.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: My most favorite backpack to date
customer_reviews.text: My most favorite backpack to date. Fits enough for an entire long weekend away. Also light enough to use as an EDC. Nothing has broken on it yet and it seems that it’ll stay that way for the foreseeable future.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Harris Bornstein

customer_reviews.title: Recommended - Good design with room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Typical Timbuk2 construction should hold up well. Thoughtful design without too many bells and whistles. Closing mechanism is ok for light rain but could use a drawcord. Easy to customize with Molle webbing on side. Water bottle pocket could be a little deeper. Recommended (and I would buy again) unless you regularly ride in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Glacier72

customer_reviews.title: Best backpack I've ever used and I show it off wherever I go
customer_reviews.text: My god do I love this backpack. I show everyone I know how cool it is, it has pockets for anything you'll need. Laptop, tablet, books side pockets for easy access. I'm telling you, it's gorgeous, can fit anything I though at it... I have a few Caribeaners on it to connect anything I need. Buy this backpack. Ask me anything if you have questions
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Holt

customer_reviews.title: Great for everyday transit!
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag everyday for traveling to and from work, which includes walking/biking to the train stations (often in crappy weather). It has so far held up while keeping my laptop and other work gear dry and has ample exterior places to hook on extra gear when I do more extensive bike rides. More than pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Kneen

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Best bag ever, it's perfect for my every day needs. Not huge but not small. Top load makes it easy to fill up to top :)
customer_reviews.author: Rut

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for! This bag is worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack. Great for traveling, biking, and every day life!
customer_reviews.author: brooks salazar

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this bag
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this bag. The overall design is great and it feels good to carry even when it's crammed full of books. However, it is decidedly *not* waterproof. The first time I rode home with it in moderate rain I found that everything in my bag - books, papers, phone - was soaked.
customer_reviews.author: ryegent

customer_reviews.title: This bag is legitness
customer_reviews.text: Great Bag. Purchased for a trip overseas and as a day pack it performs in all weather conditions very well. I recommend this to anyone that is planning on light travel. I have not used it as a laptop bag yet but I have confidence in its ability to protect a laptop. one nice undisclosed design feature is the laptop pocket's bottom seam does not stop at the bottom of the bag, rather 2-3" before the bottom so as not to hit you laptop overtime you put your bag down. Thoroughly satisfied with the bag after doing a lot of shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Chandrasurin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bag ALOT OF POCKETS !!!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is amazing has a bunch of pockets and I love to organize everything and it's weather proof, I got stuck in the rain one NYC night riding my bike back home and my MacBook Pro was dry and all my stuff and books where dry as well. Also you can it can hold your bike's u-lock perfectly right in the front without having to put the lock in your bag. Recommend this bag for any students who ride their bikes to school or someone who travels and doesn't want to spend a whole bunch of money on a bag for their computer or cameras :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Laptop bag only, not a everyday backpack.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this backpack for weekend use. As a laptop bag, it should be great. I thought it could be a weekend bag like my Swig. However the back is stiff & rigged and cannot be used in anyway other than loading up a laptop of other miscellaneous things.
customer_reviews.author: white cloud

customer_reviews.title: Great except in extreme conditions.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for everyday use. It is water resistant but in a downpour, interior will get wet.
customer_reviews.author: bvhphilly

customer_reviews.title: Backpack bag is sooo deep hard to use for everyday or anyday
customer_reviews.text: what a hassle using this. It's like a long duffel bag and its definitely not for every day. im not even sure why people have these bags. was on sale and was timbuk2 thats why i got it. Returning for a regular backpack like uptown/command/authority. was very comfortable but not usable for papers
customer_reviews.author: FirstLine 24/7 Customer Care & Support Team

customer_reviews.title: Great bag! I work in IT and use it ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bag! I work in IT and use it to carry a laptop, supplies, tools and a tasty lunch every day. The Molle straps work great for my needs and everything that I keep inside of the bag itself stays dry. My only concern long term would be the mesh bag on the side but I carry a roll of gorilla tape in there so I'm not too worried about it. 4/5
customer_reviews.author: T. R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Researched my face off for this purchase. I’ve done the work for you. Buy. This. Bag. Great volume, rugged exterior and versatility. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Keep things dry and be comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: It’s such a cozy everyday backpack. I ride in the rain a lot and not a single thing gets wet.
customer_reviews.author: C smith

customer_reviews.title: Quality bag
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad bag for the price it seems constructed of quality materials,and has a decent organization system the only thing that really bugs me is that the edges or the straps are quite narrow and dig in around my neck which really gets annoying while riding. The u lock feature is actually pretty handy as well and does a fair job of Carrying a mini evolution 5. The front side or the bag also tends to pick up quite a but of dust, lint and such which really isn't a big deal as you can just shake it off.
customer_reviews.author: jacob347

customer_reviews.title: It is very comfortable. I really enjoyed the zipper to easily remove ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack to replace my old TimBuk2 Q bag. I specifically wanted it for a 3 day trip. It held everything I needed. It is very comfortable. I really enjoyed the zipper to easily remove my laptop. I would definitely suggest this if you are looking for a new backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Merrill

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Bag
customer_reviews.text: I've been attending a lot of the protests lately and I'm constantly wearing this backpack. Great for carrying water bottles/hoodie all day!
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Awesome backpack for work/fun!
customer_reviews.text: Really great pack. At first I was skeptical of the room, but it has more than enough for my 13" Macbook Pro, iPad, Kindle, lunch, sweatshirt, and more. It is really well-built, and the unique closure at the top is much easier to use that I had initially thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: jeramyutgw

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, waterproof and light weight but limited space
customer_reviews.text: If using school books, the only downfall is the amount of books that can fit. You have to organize your books in a certain way (stacked on top of each other). Approximately 4 college textbooks can fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great!
customer_reviews.text: This just got here and i am very impressed! looks cool and still professional. great pockets and space as well!.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: I really love this bag!!!
customer_reviews.text: The bag is perfect for what I need. I love the webbings where I can molle attachments!!!
customer_reviews.author: Emdee

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bag
customer_reviews.text: Great pack for cycling. My only wish is that it had a small waist strap to take some of the load off of your shoulders if you are carrying a lot of weight. Otherwise great pack.
customer_reviews.author: D. B. J.

customer_reviews.title: Solid backpack
customer_reviews.text: Solid backpack with ALOT of room but its bigger than I expected. Well made nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best backpack ever.
customer_reviews.text: Best backpack I’ve ever had. The compartment is huge and you can store so much in there. The way it closes at top also makes it kind of adjustable so no matter how much you’re carrying, everything stats taut and in place. Love this backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: I like this bag
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag, had my last bag for about 6 years and it finally needed a replacement. Timbuk2 has some good gear and I thought I would try the pack. Looking forward to getting the most of it.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Best choice I've made
customer_reviews.text: Night a few back packs for work, most failed because the straps broke out the zipper failed. But this back pack has been going strong since I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: j.h

customer_reviews.title: Love this backpack
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack. I've been using it dailey for two months now and it's held up in rain and wind very well. It's very deep so it can hold a decent amount of stuff along with my MacBook. My only complaint is I have fairly short arms so sometimes I have a hard time reaching the bottom of the bag. Otherwise it's fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Sparrow

customer_reviews.title: perfect for anything!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Timbuk2 bag, wanted something to alternate with my classic messenger. This bag is super deep, plenty of space for pretty much anything you need. Perfect laptop slot accessible from the back, tablet slot, internal pockets - everything you need from a great daypack. Buy it, you won't regret it. Timbuk2 bags are made of high-quality material and the craftsmanship shows.
customer_reviews.author: NickB

customer_reviews.title: By far the best backpack I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: By far the best backpack I have ever owned. The construction is solid and the aesthetic is bold and minimalist. Moreover, the bag expands vertically to carry a full load when needed and folds for a more compact look when carrying everyday items. The weight distribution which is enhanced by the sternum strap makes what you're carrying feel lighter than it is. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: J
customer_reviews.text: Got this on sale and so happy about it. Nice and big multiple compartments throughout. Use it Everytime I ride . I got this on sale for a great deal so I love it
customer_reviews.author: Dan K

customer_reviews.title: Okay backpack, price should be less though.
customer_reviews.text: Good backpack but came with a small cut on the bottom of the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Bharat Parmar

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack, little bit big if you need it only for laptop and few accessories.
customer_reviews.author: idan

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great size, sturdy construction, functional features. Only complaint is my watch gets caught on the pockets inside. The pocket with a zipper on the back is in the perfect location for keeping laptop safe and easy to access.
customer_reviews.author: ljmor

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack, a couple caveats
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack overall. The straps near the top is not as wide as expected so it takes some time and adjustments to get used to. Great water resistance and overall styling. Didn't know it does not have a sleeve to slide into luggage handles, however
customer_reviews.author: Dafpunked

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bag! The waterproof lining inside and out is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag! The waterproof lining inside and out is fantastic. LOVE that the top can be adjusted and all of the extra pockets and crevices on the outside. The adjustable size is perfect for our laptop which is quite large and won't fit most bookbags.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and useful.
customer_reviews.text: Used this in Colombia to carry extra clothes, gear, or whatever I needed. It was long enough for my SCUBA flippers even. It fit my large laptop perfectly in a separate slot with a ton of extra room for other stuff.
customer_reviews.author: David Corzo

customer_reviews.title: Months of abusing this thing and it holds up like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Months of abusing this thing and it holds up like a champ. Not waterproof, but water resistant, and the MOLL-E webbing is a great touch if you're going to be using it for multiple situations like work/school/exploring/hiking/travel. Nice low profile, and it fits way more in there than you'd think it would!
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Premium bag for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Not the absolute most comfortable backpack but great materials, quality, and design. Timbuk2 is the only brand of bag I’m interested any more, they hold up for years and years, which is really of the utmost importance.
customer_reviews.author: GreenerZach

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack, would purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great backpack and it gets 4 stars for a couple reasons. 1. The pocket for pens inside the bag really is kind of useless. 2. The top, when unfolded, makes the pack really deep and kind of hard to work with. Not a huge issue.
customer_reviews.author: Logan J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tough well design bag. It holds a lot of stuff and is very expandable.
customer_reviews.author: Book Worm

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, durable construction
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, durable construction, the right bag for commuting on the light rail and extened walk to the office. I like the sudo roll top design.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Blair

customer_reviews.title: Flexible and functional
customer_reviews.text: Without having a million pockets and compartments, I find this more useful than a SwissGear bag. I usually carry a MacBook Pro, iPad, MIDI keyboard, gadgets, cords, headphones, and more. This bag also looks unique. The MOLLE-style straps are handy for hanging multi tools and flashlights.
customer_reviews.author: Fidelis Orozco

customer_reviews.title: Best bookbag I've had
customer_reviews.text: Best bookbag I've had. The way it suspends weight is amazing, I had two laptops and a 40oz water bottle in it and could barely fill it on a 3 mile bike ride. Have yet to check out the waterproofness of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag to go to work every day on public transit or biking or driving. It is well built, looks great, and huge but in a way that doesn’t feel big at all. The weight distribution is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Mueller

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic!!!! I bought this for my son, who is very particular. He uses it for books and computer, and rides his bike everywhere in Montreal so needed something comfortable and water resistant. Already a year old and heavy usage and still is like new. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Jody C.

product_meta.title: Timbuk2 Spire Backpack
product_meta.description: Waterproof rolltop plus incognito back zip access. Large main compartment for books, jacket, and other carry-on essentials. Laptop compartment fits up to 15" MacBook Pro as well as an iPad in a separate pocket. Ventilated back panel to give your back breathing room. 30 liter volume.
feature_bullets: THE SPIRE PACK: A rugged roll-top pack for your laptop and tablet

KEEP IT ORGANIZED: Front zip pocket fits smartphone, wallet, and shades; Internal organizer for pens, phones, and other small stuff; Large main compartment for books, jacket, and other carry-on essentials; Features a waterproof rolltop plus incognito back zip access; Secure zip pocket for earbuds, stylus, cards, and cash

CLEVER EXTRAS: On-strap bottle opener for party tricks and quick refreshment; Exterior webbing offers attachment for carabiners, or U-lock; Elasticized external side pocket for water bottle or U-lock; Laptop pocket compatible with 15" laptop and tablet
MATERIALS & FIT: Anodized aluminium hardware; Custom-fit strap design for a truer, more comfortable fit; Removable sternum strap; Ventilated back panel to give your back breathing room

LIFETIME WARRANTY: Timbuk2 stands behind the legendary quality and craftsmanship of all our products; We also embrace the wild, twisty ways of life; If there is a defect in the materials or workmanship we will repair the bag at our discretion for the lifetime of the product

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
